numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph provides insights into communication habits of young adults.
2. Each young adult is between 18 years and 34 years old.
3. Each young adult lives independently from his or her parents.
4. The data highlights differences between young women and young men.
5. The differences concern preferred methods for maintaining regular contact with a parent.
6. Texting is the dominant mode of communication among young women.
7. 100% of young women contact a parent via text at least once a day or a few times per week.
8. Around 75% of young men contact a parent via text at least once a day or a few times per week.
9. Young men have a higher inclination toward phone chats or video chats than young women.
10. Approximately 75% of young men use phone chats or video chats at least once a day or a few times per week.
11. About 50% of young women use phone chats or video chats at least once a day or a few times per week.
12. Digital communication is prevalent among young adults.
13. Roughly 25% of young women visit a parent in person at least once a day or a few times per week.
14. Roughly 25% of young men visit a parent in person at least once a day or a few times per week.
15. Face-to-face interaction has persistent value for close family ties.
16. The data presents a nuanced picture of a generation.
18. This generation strives to maintain strong connections with parents.
19. The title is: The Talk: Do Young Men or Women Talk More with Their Parents.
